meter.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a machine that measures and shows the amount of something you have used or the amount of money that you must pay
meter.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: A man came to read the electricity meter.
The taxi driver left the meter running while I ran in to pick up my bags.
meter.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a machine that measures the level of something
meter.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a machine which you put money into when you park your car next to it
meter.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to measure how much of something is used, and how much you must pay for it, by using a meter
meter.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: All our water is metered now.
meter.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: a thermometer (=an instrument for measuring heat)
meter.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: a machine that measures and shows the amount of something you have used or the amount of money that you must pay
meter.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: A new gas meter had to be installed before the building permit would be granted.
The revenue from parking meters in the town fell 40% in the last fiscal year.
meter.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: to measure the supply of gas, electricity etc being provided, using a meter
meter.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: The San Jose Water Co. meters the water use of the entire county.
